name:
From GUI dashboard 
 Message payloads are taken from the gui elements 
 and used according to their topics.
 A gui element must always transmit the following 
 msg structure in order to be recognised.
  msg = {
      payload: value,
      topic:topic_identifier_string
  }
info:
Message payloads are taken from the gui elements \n
and used according to their topics.\n
A gui element must always transmit the following \n
msg structure in order to be recognised.\n
 msg = {\n
     payload: value,\n
     topic:topic_identifier_string\n
 }

name:
From  g4n-rht-decode 
 Message payloads from g4n03rht decode node or 
 from any other source that transmits its payload 
 (such as Mqtt) are fed into sensor dashboard.
info:
Message payloads from g4n-rht-decode node or \n
from any other source that transmits its payload \n
(such as Mqtt) are fed into sensor dashboard.

label: Query Device
tooltip: Enter programming mode and query the selected PSN

label: Program Device
tooltip: Enter programming mode and program a queried psn

label: Refresh
tooltip: Refresh the list of the devices by listening to the CAN communications

name: sensor_enable
label: Enable Sensor
tooltip: Enable the sensor, disabling it will stop its reports

name: maint_mode_io1
label: Maintenance by external swich IO1
tooltip: Allow maintenance mode by external swich IO1

name: maint_mode_io2
label: Maintenance mode by external swich IO2
tooltip: Allow maintenance mode by external swich IO1

name: instant_average_val
label: Instant values/Average values
tooltip: Switch between instant and average values reports

name: kelvin_celsius_select
label: Celsius / Kelvin
tooltip: Select between Celsius or Kelvin reporting, Kelvin is default.

name: temp_led_blink
label: Temperature LED blink
tooltip: LED will blink when temperature alarm is triggered

name: humidity_led_blink
label: Humidity LED blink
tooltip: LED will blink when humidity alarm is triggered

name: io_led_blink
label: IO event LED blink
tooltip: LED will blink when io alarm is triggered

name: temp_io_event
label: Temp events trigger assigned IO
tooltip: Temperature event triggers assigned IO

name: humidity_io_event
label: Humidity events trigger assigned IO
tooltip: Humidity event triggers assigned IO

name: io_event_alarm
label: IO events trigger assigned IO
tooltip: Io events trigger assigned IO

name: io_filter
label: IO filter (sec)
tooltip: In order to avoid false alarms the voltage must hold the cross-limit value \n for a specified time interval defined by this parameter.

name: temp_cal
label: Temp calibration (Kelvin)
tooltip: Temp calibration always in Kelvin*100, by default the sensor is factory calibrated.

name: inst_threshold
label: Instant temp & humidity interval
tooltip: Sets the reporting of  instantaneous temperature & humidity interval

name: almt_set_max
label: Max temp for alarm triggering (K)
tooltip: Maximum temperature threshold for alarm triggering (K)

name: almt_set_min
label: Min temp for alarm triggering (K)
tooltip: Minimum temperature threshold for alarm triggering (K)

name: almh_set_max
label: Max humidity for alarm triggering (%)
tooltip: Maximum humidity threshold for alarm triggering (%)

name: almh_set_min
label: Min humidity for alarm triggering (%)
tooltip: Minimum humidity threshold for alarm triggering (%)

name: min_io1_threshold
label: Min IO1 event threshold (V)
tooltip: Minimum IO1 event threshold (V)

name: max_io1_threshold
label: Max IO1 event threshold (V)
tooltip: Maximum IO1 event threshold (V)

name: min_io2_threshold
label: Min IO2 event threshold (V)
tooltip: Minimum IO2 event threshold (V)

name: max_io2_threshold
label: Max IO2 event threshold (V)
tooltip: Maximum IO2 event threshold (V)

name: avg_threshold
label: Average temp & humidity time interval
tooltip: Sets the reporting of  average temperature & humidity interval

name: spinner
format: Indicates if devices are in programming mode.

name: Dashboard Theme : Modern Dark
info:
# Modern Dark Theme for node-red-dashboard

Inspired by Victor Lucachi with his [Node Red Dashboard Concept](https://dribbble.com/shots/10356530-Node-Red-Dashboard-Concept) on Dribbble. Thank you for your work.

## Customize

1. Go on dashboard customisation tab (At the right of Debug Console).
2. Select the style `Dark`.
3. Pick the color you want. Example `#66B5F8`

## Buttons

Use `2x2` size for buttons with icon and text on the screenshot

name: Dark theme for gui, delete if unwanted or customise if needed
To g4n-rht--encode or to any other standard transport protocol that reaches it. (ex: mqtt). \n The first node output or output 0 is always reserved for this purpouse.
info: The first node output or output 0 is always reserved for this purpouse.

name:
Node outputs are as fallows: 
 
 0 -output to g4n03rht encode - for this output no topic is neccesary 
 
 These topics are neccesary for the GUI elements and so is the order: 
 1 -"sensor_enable" 
 2 -"maint_mode_io1" 
 3 -"maint_mode_io2" 
 4 -"instant_average_val"
 5 -"kelvin_celsius_select"
 6 -"temp_led_blink"
 7 -"humidity_led_blink"
 8 -"io_led_blink"
 9 -"temp_io_event"
 10 -"humidity_io_event"
 11-"io_event_alarm"
 12-"io_filter"
 13-"temp_cal"
 14-"inst_threshold"
 15-"avg_threshold"
 16-"almt_set_max"
 17-"almt_set_min"
 18-"almh_set_max"
 19-"almh_set_min"
 20-"max_io1_th_threshold"
 21-"min_io1_th_threshold"
 22-"max_io2_th_threshold"
 23-"min_io2_th_threshold"
 24-"activate_sensor_cure"
 25-"trigger_spinner"
 26-"min_maintenance_interval"
 27-"max_maintenance_interval"
 28- Sensor_cure_confirmation 
 29- Sensor_maintenance_confirmation 
 30-"dropdown_list" 
 31- Query/programming mode ready confirmation 
 32- Sensor id label confirmation 
 *confirmations are not topic bound since they do not connect back to the dashboard node	
 *programming mode switch is available for manual debuging and uses the topic "switch_programming_mode"
info:
Node outputs are as fallows: \n
\n
0 -output to g4n03rht encode - for this output no topic is neccesary \n
\n
These topics are neccesary for the GUI elements and so is the order: \n
1 -"sensor_enable" \n
2 -"maint_mode_io1" \n
3 -"maint_mode_io2" \n
4 -"instant_average_val"\n
5 -"kelvin_celsius_select"\n
6 -"temp_led_blink"\n
7 -"humidity_led_blink"\n
8 -"io_led_blink"\n
9 -"temp_io_event"\n
10 -"humidity_io_event"\n
11-"io_event_alarm"\n
12-"io_filter"\n
13-"temp_cal"\n
14-"inst_threshold"\n
15-"avg_threshold"\n
16-"almt_set_max"\n
17-"almt_set_min"\n
18-"almh_set_max"\n
19-"almh_set_min"\n
20-"max_io1_th_threshold"\n
21-"min_io1_th_threshold"\n
22-"max_io2_th_threshold"\n
23-"min_io2_th_threshold"\n
24-"activate_sensor_cure"\n
25-"trigger_spinner"\n
26-"min_maintenance_interval"\n
27-"max_maintenance_interval"\n
28- Sensor_cure_confirmation \n
29- Sensor_maintenance_confirmation \n
30-"dropdown_list" \n
31- Query/programming mode ready confirmation \n
32- Sensor id label confirmation \n
*confirmations are not topic bound since they do not connect back to the dashboard node	\n
*programming mode switch is available for manual debuging and uses the topic "switch_programming_mode"

label: Sensor cure switch
tooltip: Switches the sensors to curing mode. The sensors will heat to  evaporate  excess humidity and will exit maintanace mode after they are done.

name: sensor cure confirmation
sensor maintenance confirmation
format: ON
